bLe9SYEZmoY5xRmJK_2XyQ.text: I ordered soba noodle with a yakisoba sauce. It was goopy and much too sweet. Not sure if they messed up my order or if they just have no idea how to make yakisoba, but it was a major disappointment and it is sitting heavily in my stomach as I write this.

ZAEwvegy5kNxI5j3HFaduw.text: The food was very good, and the staff was very friendly. I stopped here after a trip to the eye to grab a quick bite. I enjoyed the set up of the menu as I could personalize my own noodle creation. Good place :)

AHtM7hs6Pm69mi9c_jqqMQ.text: After visiting the London Eye we were looking for a place to eat and this place was nearby.  This place has a good concept - choose your noodles, choose the sauce, and choose the meat.  I went with rice noodles in black bean sauce with duck.  I thought that it was quite flavorful and you may not notice it at first since they pack the food in those Chinese to go boxes but they give you quite a lot of food.  Good place for lunch after doing some tourist activities.

__v_qF7j1YtciV-8SA00WQ.text: When I need big food, I head to Neds. They serve scrummy freshly made stir fries in those wonderful American style boxes. Choose a stir fry and have it with either udon, egg or rice (gluten free) noodles.I usually go for the Malaysian beef which has bean sprouts, red and green chillies, lime and coriander amongst other ingredients. It's saucy and quite rich. When I'm feeling a bit "vegeterianish", I go for the Thai vegetable green curry with tofu. It has chilli but is not too hot.The prices are good for the quantity of food. There is also a selection of soup noodle dishes, salads and starters. Service is quick and friendly.Neds also donates some of their profits to a charity called Mencare, which I think is really nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Neds Noodle Bar - London, United Kingdom

15r1lkWngDxmGV704Lhk_w.text: Ned's Noodles is amazing.  It's one of those slightly off the beaten track places that makes you look really cool as you stride past Wagamama's and all the other chains on South Bank, duck down a side street and come back minutes later with a steaming carton of delicious noodles that looks straight out of an episode of Friends.I'm not sure what about that is cool, maybe you had to be there when I did that, to see how cool it really was.  Anyway, my favourites are the chicken and prawns, the veggie green curry and the duck and oyster.  You get a massive portion for around £5/£6 depending on what you order and you select the type of noodle you prefer.  They also do other stuff like salads for people who don't quite get it.The staff are friendly but always seem really harassed even if it's dead.  This is a great place to grab a bite and you can eat in or take your noodles for a romantic stroll along the stinky river Thames.

photos.caption: Photo of Neds Noodle Bar - London, United Kingdom

exvJ7RESCp0eap6_tOFuJg.text: Walking from Lambeth Walk over to the London Eye, the Neds Noodle Box logo immediately drew us in. Our last experience with Asian food during our vacation wasn't so successful; sushi in Ibiza Town in Ibiza, not good! They just took the vinegar part of sushi rice TOO FAR. So we decided to go to Neds since we were fiending for anything remotely Asian, something just like at home.While it wasn't that familiar taste we were looking for, Neds hit the spot. Though, a little too much sauce! It was decent tasting, portions were generous, it was convenient, quick and there were lots of menu options. In fact, Ned was at the register when we were there. Felt like a little cool take-out lunch joint you'd find in SOMA in San Francisco. Neat spot.

hrKWJCSRfsgURGxKhRbMJg.text: First meal for first day in London=nice find just around the corner from The Eye. It's Chinese food... to go, so expect it to be just that. For the type of food, it's pretty good. Service was fast and friendly.  It's pricey for the amount of food, but it's in a tourist area so expect no less. If you're new to Chinese noodles, oyster sauce is the go-to sauce for most asian marinade so go with that if you have no desire to be adventurous. Chinese bbq was good, thai curry tastes as it sounds and sweet and sour is good but can get boring because the flavor is typically not meant as a sauce for noodles in my opinion. Careful for the bot sauce!

QYgy-mekNJdkvAi_PZZ8nA.text: I love the idea of Ned's Noodle bar - nice big portions of noodles packaged neatly in a box. I've been in here quite a few times now but I've never really thought much of Ned's Noodle Bar.The noodles are OK but nothing great. There are lots of options for meat eaters and veggies but this place is really like a mini-Wagamama to go.Ned's Noodle Bar is fine for a quick bit but don't go out of your way to eat here - there are lots more interesting places on the Southbank.

photos.caption: Photo of Neds Noodle Bar - London, United Kingdom

FQquyB10b-cCbl9FKpLO_A.text: Ordered this tonight, actually. I used the online delivery, which requires a 10 quid minimum and adds 1 for a delivery charge. I ordered the seaweed starter, the chicken and prawn with rice noodles, and banana fritters. The "fritters" (actually spring rolls with banana inside and honey outside) were the best of the three. The seaweed was overly spicy, salty, and tough to chew, and I just really didn't like the noodle dish at all. It was more than 80% noodles and very bland. The prices are also too high. However, the delivery was rapid and courteous and it's good to try new things, but I won't be back.

LSN7pjZQZqm054cl9zScTA.text: This place is just a pile of shit !!!!!! We went and got some food. It seemed like they used some old noodles. The preparation was Malaysian beef with udon. We realized mistakes do happen, so we went up to the counter to tell them about it and ask them to change it.The girl @ the counter decided she needed to give me cooking lessons in malaysian food. She went onto explain how malaysian food taste like that. She did not change it, inspite of repeated requests since the stuff was bad food.I realize in UK the concept of customer service is mute, but this is just unacceptable !!!

9jBQPP9EN7dKzu50zSP5xA.text: This is in a great convenient location and should be a nice place to grab a quick and tasty bite whilst seeing the South Bank sites. However, the bites all taste exactly the same to me. We ordered several boxes of different varieties and could not tell which was which. So, if you are hungry and need a quick, bland, overpriced for what you get, noodle fix, Ned is your man.

17kjeGs6lup3UlYdqEIG6Q.text: Neds serve cheap, quick noodles in those takeout boxes you see on American movies. I get Chicken udon noodles, prawn toast and beer for about a tenner and I am always full and happy by the end. Perfect for a quick scoff after work.

J8SR63kqK1vbq-g1zm5dXA.text: Was recommended to this place by a local London cabbie,on first inspection I was somewhat sceptical as t's only a small restaraunt with around 6 tables outside and probably the same inside,the majority of the food is taken away.Quite a lagre variety to choose from.obviously it's mostly noodles,going by the name of the place,but they also do spring rolls etc.Each order comes in a noodle boxvery cute,and chopsticks.I found the food extremely tasty and especially handy if your looking for food where you on't have to wait ages to be served etc.Staff were very nice and served you extremely quickly.

CRRPsfl4RTDovt0nGcDGzA.text: Love this place! No longer live in London, but have very fond memories of going here, and will certainly pop back next time I'm around. They do a good range of noodles in boxes which you can take away or eat just out the front of the place on their tables. Being a great location, used to get a noodle box, couple of spring rolls (also in a box), bottle of coke and head to the river. Realy can't fault it.

tddUZHa76ThoIm0dXtlZRA.text: It was one of those days where, after a busy and slightly depressing morning, I thought to myself 'time to have a treat for lunch.' And I was just in that mood for noodles, you know that mood that overcomes you (presumably it is dictated by your stomach), so after a quick wander I found this independent chain and went for it.Nice interior, little bit like a diner but they hadn't taken the theme all the way.Friendly staff, they didn't give you that bored look when you're staring at the menu - normally I hate those people that get to the front of a queue and then try and decide what to have. Fortunately today there was not queue so I didn't care as much!I had chinese bbq (if that exists, it tasted like teriyaki) chicken egg noodles - you can choose your protein, noodle type and sauce which is always nice. Possible to accompany it with some spring rolls etc but I though that would make me look too fat on my own - this is the point in the review where the readers should exclaim, 'You, fat, never!' Thanks in advance for that guys!£7.25 was expensive food the look of the place (fast food-esque) so I was expecting good noodles and was a bit disappointed. They were quite greasy and swimming in sauce. If it cost £5 I would be fine with that, but there were no better than Wasabi and 1.5x the price. Portion was less too.All in all, not worth it. If I'm fancying noodles again I will go a few metres further in the other direction and stick with Wasabi.

photos.caption: Photo of Neds Noodle Bar - London, United Kingdom. Chinese BBQ
Photo of Neds Noodle Bar - London, United Kingdom. Like the sign, feels retro

AFhArSlZ865EEqrbOerjEA.text: It's like Subway but with noodles. You choose the type of noodles, then the sauces, then the filling, and you get your perfect noodle meal in a little cute box (just a standard noodle pailor box  - the take aways have a little handle too). The dishes are prepared quickly (10mins tops), served hot and perfect to go - so if you're having a business meeting around Westminster and you need to catch a quick lunch, this is a place to go. The quantity is good - perfect to fill one very hungry stomach, can be also a shared snack for two. Good for everyone - all ages should be happy. They are also halaal making it a bit easier for muslim londoners.

su1MQOQ2CvN7A6He9LCv1A.text: Staying right down the street in London and for really fast great food do come here ! Been here four times already in 8 days

photos.caption: Photo of Neds Noodle Bar - London, United Kingdom. Thai spicy sauce hot with rice

vbpyB-l042sNcefDapEI8A.text: Had the noodles with black bean and i think it just had soy sauce....disappointing. Always a bad sign when no asian people are eating or cooking at an asian restaurant...

XOIKc0MsN9rU35dXwb3LMQ.text: I feel like noodle bars have been popping up all over the place in Europe. With that being said, I'd say this place is definitely average/below avrg compared to other places. The inside is not the cleanest, looks kinda old. It's also more expensive (but I guess it is London...). I ordered the noodles with yellow curry sauce, chicken, broccoli, and mushrooms. The quality is decent but I found that the sauce was not that flavorful. The presentation is also really messy. If there were other restaurants that were more appealing nearby, I probably wouldnt eat here again. Places like Wok to Walk have way nicer decor, cheaper price point, and better tasting food.

AAMrXyllIx0MYZVZbsAZhQ.text: Greet noodle house that was around the corner from our hotel. They make it fresh as you wait and it delish! Quick and easy for takeaway if you're on the go.

7fJA7tUXbQB71bK0Sf15Og.text: There were three of us, and each of us tried different noodles and different sauces.  All three were bland--even the one that was labeled "spicy" on the menu.  Really fast and convenient, but we wished we had picked a different spot for a quick bite to eat.

ZbLi7eHwFYfCfL86sV1ZrA.text: Stopped in and had a quick dinner after a day of sight seeing. Each dish ordered was very tasty and good. We have the spicy Thai sauce with chicken and beef with a black bean sauce both with egg noodles. Dishes were hot and lots of flavour. Reasonably priced and portions were good.

Vq9fJ9a5AvO0v4wqLJau3A.text: Neds Noodle Bar is cute little noodle shop in a super touristy part of London. And with all things touristy, the price is quite a bit higher than it really should be. For two waters and two noodle boxes, we paid about $35 USD. Everything was good, but $35 for some noodles? But if you're in this area and need a quick bite to eat, Neds won't let you down.

8_p1FCkmoVZQ3qeUyBMzzQ.text: There are not many (if any) other Fresh made to order Noodles in a box places in London (except for the other branch of Neds in Westbourne grove). This is why I give it 4 stars! You order the type of noodles you want with whatever sauce/meat/seafood/veg combo off the menu, and your order is made up fresh in front of you.I am a fan because it's a much better healthier take away meal option than alot of the other junk that they sell around Southbank.My only gripe is the fact that they charge for every little extra (I think around £1 for extra chilli!). They should have free condiments for people to spice up their own, like in most good Asian eateries.Still recommend though!

Hg8XY6LNY8fa7PybzURjYQ.text: I was with my two sons, age 12 and 16, in London for summer vacation. None of us are picky eaters and we enjoy many types of food, especially Asian cuisines. Chinese, Thai, Japanese, Vietnamese, Korean, Indian...we like them all. My boys are at that age where they like to eat large portions of most anything in sight. We had just come from a morning tour of the Tower of London to ride the London Eye and we had not had breakfast. We were starving! Arriving about an hour early, we decided to grab a bite at Ned's Noodle Bar before taking the ride up for a fantastic view of London. Ned's offers three type of noodles and an assortment of meats. Each of us ordered a different noodle and a different meat item so that we could try a nice variety of things. Unfortunately, all three dishes were a BIG disappointment. The noodles did not taste fresh, the meat portions were tiny, and the flavor was just not good. Despite being very hungry, neither of my sons ate half of a very average size portion of food. We all agreed, Ned's Noodle Bar deserves a 1 star rating...at best! I would not waste your time or money at this place.

1I2IVpHkBix6JP8fR5KrjQ.text: To get out of the bloody rain and to warm up our souls, we ordered 2 seafood laskas.  Pretty good seafood soup in cocunut currry broth simillar to thom ga thai dish.  My moms was cooked with different noodles as to mine, didnt care.  I get the whole to go order box but soup being served in that was kinda annoying.  Put it in a bowl please.  Service was meh.  Egg rolls sucked and lacked in flavor.  Cost us about 17 pounds.

jnpSyOZ9HDPk7XUd0m_j_Q.text: Good for a late night noodle fix (open til 11.30) but not outstanding. Very filling but the sauces all tasted the same. 6 choices of noodle, 6 choices of meat/veg and 6 choices of sauce. Spring rolls, prawn crackers etc for starters and you can add extras for 50p to the noodles. Better than a late night kebab but not worth a special journey.

zJdKIJXNkJIIpvrW21ROnw.text: Stopped at Ned's late in the evening last week and was pleasantly surprised. I picked my noodle, meat, and sauce and what I got was great. A take away box filled with hot tender noodles and beef with big flavor. The place is open late and next to County Hall so if you're in the area this place is defiantly worth stopping at.

bLB4CcQ_Gt11QPIem_Q13Q.text: Came to Neds for a quick bite to eat while visiting the Big Ben. The restaurant had a long line so I assumed it must have been good. The price is extremely affordable at around 6-8 pounds for a meal, however the wait is well over 20 minutes and the food is mediocre. The meal was warm as they prepare it on the spot, but the sweet and sour chicken was a huge disappointment. My girlfriend got the vegetable udon with Thai Curry and was satisfied. Overall not a stand out experience

AKOG6KWWplkfcLo5NhD04Q.text: This place is distinctly average! So many better places to get noodles! My Thai green chicken curry tasted so boring. Had to put loads of sweet chilli on it to spice it up and give it more flavour! The spring rolls were good though!

Z52FyOr0vieDbTQNd52hBQ.text: I've been here several times in the evening on the way from A to B in the vicinity of Waterloo / Southbank and found it by accident a while back and I'm a fan for several reasons:- I love Asian style noodles. - When I am hungry yet don't want to hang around too long, I want to eat quickly.- Good sized portions (can't stand measly portion sizes for fast food).- They serve the noodles in  those 'chinese  takeaway' boxes with the little wire carry handle and chopsticks (I like the kitsch factor yet completely practical so you can eat in or take away).- Made to order and steaming hot.- Choice of different types of noodle and different style combos (chicken, veg, fish, spicy, non spicy etc)- Soft drinks or beer, if you want.- You order and your food comes. Friendly staff,no BS or attitude.- The place won't rock your world in terms of your foodie experience here but it's perfectly good and it is what it is. Good value too.Check all of the above.All round a successful formula.

eQl1TadeES70uXEEbso3aQ.text: Don't be fooled by its appearance.  This is not a cheap joint.  The food is terrible and terribly expensive because the servicing portions are tiny.  It was some of the worst Asian food that I've experienced in my life.  Do not go to Neds Noodle Bar in Waterloo.  McDonald's would be a much better value for your money.

XvOIQVX9n_6ske-LnS1qRA.text: I went to Ned's for dinner and had a chicken Chinese barbecue egg noodles. The food was good and the quantity is nice for the price. I think that one box is enough for two if you are not very hungry.

9leEaoMgjPTR2qPxaIo-WQ.text: I must admit that I quite like this place and its faux-Asian noodle dishes.  Perfect for a cheap and cheerful and quick lunch or light dinner.

NP5Wl7hnPqsFAX_qioVwjA.text: Around the corner from our hotel.  We wanted a simple no fuss meal our first night in town.  This was the perfect stop.  The concept is basic enough.  You pick the type of noodle, the type of protein, the sauce and the size.  They have beer and wine.  Everything comes in a paper box and they have plenty of tables outside or you can take on the go.  If looking for something fast and simple and in this area then I recommend.

zGL46VNrhO4S38PLKt6ohw.text: Not accommodating, not willing to substitute, will not sale a side of sauce on the side. I can't tell you how the food taste because the service was so bad and I lost my appetite. I'm very bummed because how often does one really make it to  London. I love trying new foods.

kQtOJ-7FFV2ivec7qRp2BA.text: This stop win the spin the bottle contest when deciding on lunch. Food was plentiful, but could use a little zhushing when it comes to flavor. My mom and husband ordered the rice with Spicy thai sauce. The both thought it to be too salty and requested more rice to balance out the flavors. I ordered the Udon noodles with Chinese BBQ sauce with beef. The beef wasn't beefy enough for me...the texture seemed off. The udon noodles were spot on with chewiness and texture. I only ate half of the portion...there was a ton. Definitely could share. My toddler absolutely loved.

photos.caption: Photo of Neds Noodle Bar - London, United Kingdom

qNK85Jti5ZiFAFvEcFaY7w.text: LOVE the concept of this noodle bar. You pick your type of noodles, sauce, and meat (if any) and they give it to you in a cute to-go container. I think the concept is great and unique, but the food was only okay. I felt like my noodles were drowning in sauce. I like to taste the sauce obviously, but by the time I got to the bottom I couldn't really eat it anymore. They have free wi-fi though, which is nice when you're traveling!

QLhDR1_51pxGYdGNa5Bc1w.text: Long story short the food is gross. They use way too much starch in their sauces, makes me gag just thinking about it. We are so not eating fast Chinese ever again, no thanks. So, we ended up with the pretty menu handed to us on the street and after daily 70£ dinners we decided to go there for a less costly family of five meal one night. Somehow though we still ended up paying close to 60£ for the whole meal. I would say no matter what the sauce was, all the dishes tasted pretty much the same, some more fishy, but I've never seen such a gross chicken on rice that my 4 year old got - the chicken was literally in a glue like sauce, sticky and slimy. Yuk, he totally passed on that. Green curry was more like a starchy sauce with some curry taste. Vegetables - mostly carrots, canned corn, some overbooked cabbage.

aCH6lMSQ67s7kYoGLMfV9w.text: Yuck! I guess I can appreciate their intentions, but it wasn't for me. I was expecting something "pho-like". If I'm not mistaken, this is a chain-restaurant. So, somebody must like it. I can't even remember what I had...or what my husband had....I just remember we didn't like it LOL

Aj2J8dtKV5FfaViPZTR8nQ.text: Dish are very good after a long time spent at London Eye.  We are starving & the food just warmed & filled up our tummies.

photos.caption: Photo of Neds Noodle Bar - London, United Kingdom

LJirhFogge6gub3xHMYSDw.text: If I could give a zero, it'd be a zero. $7.95 for a regular udon noodle with beef and I only get 1 piece of beef after I dug through the whole thing asking "I did prder beef right?" Unacceptable!!! Don't waste your time with this place, just walk a block down and get Subways, at least you see what they put in your food

photos.caption: Photo of Neds Noodle Bar - London, United Kingdom

IzG0as2to0GRHhqy-gpKYA.text: I love this place and come back whenever we are in London. I somehow work it into the schedule and this week was no different. My daughter asked to try it I am always singing it's praises. She is starting with the kids egg noodles and chicken. She did want duck but the lady at the counter would change it from the 'fixed' menu (reason for 4  rating). Still love them.

XCDHeaYZO4Hy3v1v2WRrXg.text: We came here hungry, and the portions were well sized and there were clear gluten free options. I got the rice noodles with beef and yakisoba sauce. I felt that the sauce was off, and the vegetables had a strange after taste. Couldn't get through half the box. My husband enjoyed his green curry sauce much more.

YqT-91cnrYh4JAE1E5IrNg.text: Food is very bland, they give your very little of your protein of choice, and they sloppily cross contaminate their gluten-free noodle with gluten-containing noodles. Not worth going here.

52RyvS_D7BnEg5cNgslJ9g.text: Honestly, I almost didn't eat here due to the low stars. But I was traveling in London with my wife and four kids under 12 years old and my 4 year old wanted Noddles! Anyway, the meal was great. I had Tofu Singapore sauce. A ways through I said to my wife, This is actually really good. She agreed. It was great. Thank you, please visit this place. I recommend it.

1nzfROUVdV0IWJisPT3eIw.text: A must try while by the London eye.  Simple menu, great tasting Thai Sauce but not to hot.  Chicken Gzoya starter is very tasty.  Walked in to a very long line that took no time to get through and order.  Food came out as quick as the line moved.  Perfectly cooked.I did rice, Thai sauce and chicken, hit the spot.  Next time I am going for the egg noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of Neds Noodle Bar - London, United Kingdom. Neds Noodle Bar - best Chinese take-away I have had in awhile.

rnc_oPKpKvjIMhi0fdn35A.text: Food gave bad stomachache. Sauce used was not yakisoba- don't know what it was. Delivery took too long. Food too expensive for quality given. Will not return.

cQ0JMnSdef8qMHKnYc6c8w.text: We stopped by here because it was open late and it was cheap. Even though I chose a sauce base that was supposed to be spicy--it wasn't. And my food didn't taste like much at all. I had to use a lot of English sriracha (not nearly as spicy as the stuff in America) and soy sauce to make my food taste like anything at all. Service was nice and prompt but food was mediocre. Don't do it.

koADJLHrNfGSZgG3OTbmMw.text: Looks and smells amazing, the food was very bland... it didn't taste good at all . The service was okay, kinda waited a little while they talked, but me and a buddy didn't finish our food. It wasn't at all what we expected.

VFX6kVRvQLleLzjf5rt-Zg.text: You can order your favorite noodle by 3 step, choose base noodle, sauce, and filling. It's convenient and taste good, if you like southeast asia food, it will be a good choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Neds Noodle Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Neds Noodle Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Neds Noodle Bar - London, United Kingdom

fq_FOzhdzjRtwI2WVgzNVQ.text: okay place pricey for value, couldve been better. customer service was poor and not much seating.

cVTJsZBLaFpoXXQdCgiRRA.text: Great concept. Terrible execution. I was starving after a morning fighting the tourist crowds, so I did end up eating five bites of the huge portion. It was so bland. After throwing away the rest, I let the two women know who we're looking at the menu outside. Keep walking, ladies!

wpz1_cc_s7O-fr7n4oS6uQ.text: Starving when we ate there earlier. Got Thai noodles, beef sweet and sour noodles,  Malaysian shrimp noodles, spicy vegetarian noodle and some gyoza. We I ordered drinks as well. The price is average for the area. The taste and quality of the food is just as average. Considering we just flew in from a 12 hour flight,  I suppose this place can't be called as first choice. There are better food choices near by.
